Title: SELF-DIRECTED LEARNING: A META-ANALYTIC REVIEW OF ADULT LEARNING CONSTRUCTS
Authors: Diane R. Edmondson, Stefanie L. Boyer
Abstract: This article is a meta-analytic study examining the relationship between self-directed learning and constructs that have received research attention in the education domain including academic performance, future aspiration, creativity, curiosity, and life satisfaction. Meta-analytic results show that self-directed learning is significantly and positively related to academic performance (r = .15, p < .001), future aspiration (r = .13, p < .001), creativity (r = .25, p < .001), curiosity (r = .40, p < .01), and life satisfaction (r = .35, p < .001). These results show that self-directed learning is an important construct and should be implemented into business education.

Title: Book Review: Blended Learning Environments to Foster Self-Directed Learning, edited by Christo van der Westhuizen, Mncedisi C. Maphalala, and Roxanne Bailey (AOSIS Books, 2022)
Journal: International Review of Research in Open and Distance Learning
Abstract: Blended Learning Environments to Foster Self-Directed Learning is the eighth book in the Self-Directed Learning Series by North-West University, South Africa. The volume provides strategies and approaches to promote self-directed learning (SDL) in blended learning environments, featuring contributions from authors experienced in active learning strategies in online and blended learning contexts.

Title: Self-directed learning in health professions education.
Journal: Annals of the Academy of Medicine, Singapore
Abstract: INTRODUCTION Self-directed learning has been recommended as a promising methodology for lifelong learning in medicine. However, the concept of self-directed learning continues to be elusive, with students and educators finding difficulty in defining it and agreeing on its worth. METHODS In this paper we review the literature of self-directed learning in health professions education and present a framework based on Malcolm Knowles' key components of self-directed learning. RESULTS The key components of self-directed learning are: the educator as a facilitator, identification of learning needs, development of learning objectives, identification of appropriate resources, implementation of the process, commitment to a learning contract and evaluation of learning. Several but not all of these components are often described in the published literature. CONCLUSION Although the presented framework provides some consistency for educators interested in applying SDL methods, future studies are needed to standardise self-directed learning curricula and to determine the effectiveness of these components on educational outcomes.

Title: The Concept of Self-Directed Learning: Implications for Practice in the Undergraduate Curriculum
Abstract: Self-directed learning (SDL) is a modality where learners are expected to take responsibility for their own learning, diagnose gaps in their learning, frame their own goals and resources for learning, implement appropriate learning strategies and evaluate learning outcomes. Flexibility and creativity in designing assignments for students to work individually or collaboratively are the keys to promoting SDL. The recent competency-based curriculum document from the National Medical Commission does not elaborate the concept or implementation of SDL, leaving it open to individual interpretation.

Title: Developing Self-Directed Learners
Abstract: Objective. To discuss the meaning of self-directed learning, challenges with implementation, and strategies to overcome obstacles in educational settings. In this paper we define self-directed learning, differentiate it from similar terminology, and discuss the empirical evidence for its development and strategies for its use within higher education. Summary. Self-directed learning as a defined teaching pedagogy has been around since the 1960s and can be used in classroom and experiential settings.

Title: Rethinking Pedagogy: Interrogating Ways of Promoting Deeper Learning in Higher Education
Authors: Talent T. Rugube, Khetsiwe Mthethwa-Kunene, C. Maphosa
Journal: European Journal of Interactive Multimedia and Education
Abstract: Teaching and learning in higher education should shift from surface learning to deeper learning. Deeper learning provides opportunities for students to achieve high learning outcomes. However, there is a dearth of information on the utilization of deeper learning in higher education. Deeper learning demands educators to employ pedagogy that enhances the acquisition of higher-order skills.

Title: Andragogy and Self-Directed Learning: Pillars of Adult Learning Theory
Abstract: The central question of how adults learn has occupied the attention of scholars and practitioners since the founding of adult education as a professional field of practice in the 1920s. Some eighty years later, we have no single answer, no one theory or model of adult learning that explains all that we know about adult learners, the various contexts where learning takes place, and the process of learning itself.

Title: Using technology to encourage self-directed learning: The Collaborative Lecture Annotation System (CLAS)
Authors: Shane Dawson, Leah P. Macfadyen, FR Evan, Tom Foulsham, Alan Kingstone
Abstract: The rapidly-developing 21st century world of work and knowledge calls for self-directed lifelong (SDL) learners. While higher education must embrace the types of pedagogies that foster SDL skills in graduates, the pace of change in education can be glacial. This paper describes a social annotation technology, the Collaborative Lecture Annotation System (CLAS), that can be used to leverage existing teaching and learning practices for acquisition of 21st Century SDL skills.

Title: Self-directed learning : a guide for learners and teachers / Malcom S. Knowles
Abstract: (missing abstract)

Title: Self-direction in Adult Learning: Perspectives on Theory, Research and Practice
Abstract: A self-directed learner is one who takes sole responsibility for his or her own learning. The idea is not a new one but has recently received renewed attention in education circles and has particular significance for the adult education sector. Self-direction represents a significant shift from traditional academic planning. It emphasizes autonomy and personal development and is now considered an important component of courses, not just in independent study or for external degrees, but in, for example, literacy training, continuing professional training, or computer and video technology.

Title: Self-Directed Adult Learning: Then and Now
Journal: New Directions for Adult and Continuing Education
Abstract: Self‐directed learning (SDL) has become increasingly important in today's fast‐paced and ever‐changing society. This paper explores SDL's historical evolution, theoretical foundations, and practical applications, particularly in online environments. SDL is defined as a personal attribute and a process that empowers learners to take the initiative and responsibility for their education.

Title: Andragogy and Self-Directed Learning: Pillars of Adult Learning Theory
Abstract: Andragogy and self-directed learning continue to be important to our present-day understanding of adult learning.

Title: Self-Directed Learning: Toward a Comprehensive Model
Abstract: Self-directed learning is a core theoretical construct distinguishing adult education as a field of study. Most of the concept's emphasis has been on the external control and management of learning tasks. In an attempt to expand the scope of self-directed learning, this paper presents a comprehensive theoretical model. The proposed model integrates self-management (contextual control), self-monitoring (cognitive responsibility), and motivational (entering and task) dimensions to reflect a meaningful and worthwhile approach to self-directed learning.

Title: Self-direction for lifelong learning: a comprehensive guide to theory and practice
Abstract: Part 1 The scope and meaning of self-directed learning: what is self-directed learning? the growth of interest in self-directed learning promise and limitations for education and training. Part 2 Four dimensions of self-direction: personal autonomy self-management in learning the independent pursuit of learning learner-control of instruction. Part 3 New theoretical insights on self-directed learning...

Title: Teaching Learners To Be Self-Directed
Abstract: Based on the Situational Leadership model of Hersey and Blanchard (1988), the Staged Self-Directed Learning Model proposes that learners advance through stages of increasing self-direction and that teachers can help or hinder that development. Good teaching matches the learner's stage of self-direction and helps the learner advance toward greater self-direction.

Title: Self-Directed Learning
Journal: Perspectives on psychological science : a journal of the Association for Psychological Science
Abstract: A widely advocated idea in education is that people learn better when the flow of experience is under their control (i.e., learning is self-directed). However, the reasons why volitional control might result in superior acquisition and the limits to such advantages remain poorly understood. In this article, we review the issue from both a cognitive and computational perspective.

Title: Self-Direction in Adult Learning
Abstract: A self-directed learner is one who takes sole responsibility for his or her own learning. The idea is not a new one but has recently received renewed attention in education circles and has particular significance for the adult education sector. Self-direction represents a significant shift from traditional academic planning. It emphasizes autonomy and personal development and is now considered an important component of courses.

Title: Self-Directed Learning in Problem-Based Learning and its Relationships with Self-Regulated Learning
Authors: Sofie M. M. Loyens, Joshua Magda, R. Rikers
Abstract: (missing abstract)

Title: Self-directed learning in nurse education: a review of the literature.
Abstract: RATIONALE Self-directed learning is essential in assisting nurses to meet the challenges presented in today's health care environment. Nurse educators have an important role to play in assisting nurses to acquire the skills for self-directed learning, and to do this they need to understand the concept of self-directed learning. AIM The aim of this review is to explore the concept of self-directed learning and its use in nurse education.

Title: Development and Validation of an Instrument to Identify Self-Directed Continuing Learners
Abstract: This study sought to describe the personality characteristics of self-directed continuing learners, develop an instrument to identify such learners, and conduct empirical investigations to validate the instrument. Dimensions of the self-directed continuing learner's personality were developed and then used in the construction of an item pool.

Title: Self-directed learning – a learning issue for students and faculty!
Abstract: Self-directed learning (SDL), is an essential concept in problem-based learning (PBL), and, in a broader sense, student-centred learning. Considering the complex nature of SDL, it has been taken for granted and given a shallow meaning, i.e. self-study. In order to develop a deeper understanding and make use of the potential in SDL, this paper discusses and puts forward a more profound meaning.

Title: Development of the PRO-SDLS: A Measure of Self-Direction in Learning Based on the Personal Responsibility Orientation Model
Abstract: The purpose of this study was to develop a reliable and valid instrument to measure self-directedness in learning among college students based on an operationalization of the personal responsibility orientation (PRO) model of self-direction in learning. The resultant 25-item Personal Responsibility Orientation to Self-Direction in Learning Scale (PRO-SDLS) was found to be a highly reliable instrument in the selected sample of graduate and undergraduate education students.

Title: Self-Directed Learning
Authors: Stefanie L. Boyer, D. Edmondson, Andrew B. Artis, David E. Fleming
Abstract: A meta-analytic review of self-directed learning (SDL) research over 30 years, five countries, and across multiple academic disciplines is used to explore its relationships with five key nomologically related constructs for effective workplace learning. The meta-analysis revealed positive relationships between SDL and internal locus of control, motivation, performance, self-efficacy, and support.

Title: Assessment Strategies for Self-Directed Learning
Abstract: The best ebooks about Assessment Strategies For Self Directed Learning that you can get for free here by download this Assessment Strategies For Self Directed Learning and save to your desktop. This ebooks is under topic such as assessment strategies for self directed learning experts effective online instructional and assessment strategies self-assessment in self-directed learning.

Title: Perspectives On Self-Directed Learning
Abstract: Self-directed learning in adults is considered predominantly a process of self-instruction. This conception is inadequate because it fails to account for persistence in learning and excludes adults who are unable to plan self-instruction. These inadequacies, however, can be addressed by studying self-directed learning as it relates to the learner's personality.

Title: Development of an Instrument to Measure Self-Directedness
Abstract: The purpose of this study was to develop a reliable and valid instrument to measure self-directedness in learning within the framework of the teaching-learning (TL) and learner characteristics (LC) components of the Personal Responsibility Orientation (PRO) Model of Self-Direction (Brockett & Hiemstra, 1 99 1 ) among college students.

Title: Examination of The Big Five And Narrow Traits In Relation To Learner Self-Direction
Abstract: Self-direction in learning is a major topic in the field of adult learning. There has been extensive coverage of the topic by theorists, researchers, and practitioners. However, there have been few studies which look at learner self-direction specifically as a personality trait. The present study addresses the relationship between learner selfdirection and other personality traits of college students when the traits represented by the five-factor model of personality (Digman, 1990) are differentiated from narrow personality traits.

Title: An Analysis of the Characteristics of Self-Directed Learners and Strategies to Enhance Self-Directed Learning in Education Systems: Transcending Boundaries
Abstract: Education can allow individuals to transcend boundaries of space, identity, and culture by empowering learners with the ability to pursue self-directed, lifelong learning. Valuable new meanings and understandings can be created by the interaction between self-motivated, self-directed learners, communities, and a wide range of organizations (Rogers, 2004).

Title: Self-directed learning and distance education
Journal: International Journal of E-Learning & Distance Education / Revue internationale du e-learning et la formation à distance
Abstract: Moore befasst sich in diesem Papier mit dem Verhaltnis von 'selbstbestimmten Lernen' und 'Fernstu­dium'. Beim Fernstudium, bei dem die Lerner vom Lehrenden raumlich getrennt ist und in dem die Kom­munikation zwischen Lerner und der lehrenden Institution medial vermittelt ist, bestimmen die Fakto­ren Dialog" und "Struktur" (vgl. ZIFF-Papiere 16) das Ausmas
LitmapsId: in dem das Lehren an die individuellen Bedurfnisse und Fahigkeiten der Lernenden angepasst werden kann."

Title: Development of the self-directed learning readiness scale
Abstract: (missing abstract)

Title: Self-Directed Learning: From Theory to Practice
Abstract: (missing abstract)

Title: Self-directed learning in a socioconstructivist learning environment
Authors: Foo Sze-yeng, Raja Maznah Raja Hussain
Abstract: (missing abstract)

Title: Self directed learning.
Abstract: The ability to acquire skills in self directed learning may be the key link between undergraduate education, postgraduate training, and continuing professional development. If future and current practitioners are to adopt an ongoing reflective and critical approach to practice, we should aim to provide learning opportunities that promote self confidence, question asking and reflection, openness and risk taking, uncertainty and surprise.

Title: Exploratory Study of the Relationship between Self-Directed Learning and Academic Performance in a Web-Based Learning Environment
Journal: Online Journal of Distance Learning Administration
Abstract: Through literature review, this paper examines six empirical studies. Three cases are from the United States and the other three are from studies conducted in Asian. The purpose of this study is to identify whether or not self-directed learning is a key factor leading to successful academic performance in webbased learning environments.

Title: Enhancing self-directed learning through a content quiz group learning assignment
Abstract: This article presents the findings of an empirical study that examined the learning value of a novel group assessment activity aimed at promoting first-year students' development of basic self-directed learning skills required for university study. A content quiz group learning assignment was designed to enhance students' capacity to ask appropriate questions to guide their enquiry, identify appropriate resources and tools, and draw links between different learning resources, all skills embedded within their learning in a science unit.

Title: An Examination of Learner Self-Direction in Relation to the Big Five and Narrow Personality Traits
Authors: Jeral R. Kirwan, John W. Lounsbury, Lucy W. Gibson
Abstract: The present study addresses the relationship between learner self-direction and other personality traits of college students when the traits represented by the five-factor model of personality are differentiated from narrow personality traits. Correlation and multiple regression analyses were used with a sample of 2,102 college students to examine the unique individual relationship between Big Five and narrow personality traits and learner self-direction.

Title: Self-directed learning.
Abstract: (missing abstract)

Title: Vocational education of young adults in England: a systemic analysis of teaching–learning transactions that facilitate self-directed learning
Abstract: Abstract Fostering the skills necessary for self-directed learning is an important endeavour of vocational education and training in many contexts internationally. However, there is a distinct lack of studies that investigate the extent to which facilitation of self-directed learning is present within vocational education and training in different contexts.

Title: Self-Directed Learning, A Guide for Learners and Teachers
Abstract: (missing abstract)

Title: The Antecedents toward Self-Directed Learning among Distance Learner in Malaysian Public Universities
Abstract: This paper reviews the underpinning theories and past literature on self-directed learning in relation to self-efficacy by distance learner in higher learning institutions. There is little research available that systematically traces the extent to which individual and external factors play a role in level of self-directed learning ability.

Title: Lessons from Self-Directed Learning Activities and Helping University Students Think Critically
Abstract: This work presents the benefits of self-directed learning activities as tools for enhancing critical thinking of university students. Self-directed learning is best introduced to students during the transition period from high school to the university (Van et al., 2015), and then reinforced throughout the university years.

Title: Guidelines and strategies for fostering and enhancing self-directed online learning
Authors: Meina Zhu, Curtis J. Bonk, Meina Zhu, Curtis J. Bonk
Journal: Open Learning: The Journal of Open, Distance and e-Learning
Abstract: he aim of this article is to provide practical instructional design strategies to foster and enhance learners' online self-directed learning skills and abilities; especially when accessing massive open online courses (MOOCs) and other forms of open educational resources and OpenCourseWare (OCW).

Title: The relationship among motivation, self-monitoring, self-management, and learning strategies of MOOC learners
Journal: Journal of Computing in Higher Education
Abstract: Abstract In massive open online learning courses (MOOCs) with a low instructor-student ratio, students are expected to have self-directed learning abilities. This study investigated the relationship among motivation, self-monitoring, self-management, and MOOC learners' use of learning strategies.

Title: Problem-based, self-directed learning
Abstract: (missing abstract)

Title: Self-Directed Learning (SDL) in Higher Education: Practices and Issues
Authors: Dilani Kanishka Abeyrathne, Sakunthala Yatigammana Ekanayake
Abstract: SDL is considered to be a fundamental educational goal. However, higher education institutes are challenged when promoting SDL. Therefore, the present study aims to, explore existing practices of self-direct learning implemented in the Faculty and to identify problems of undergraduates when they are engaging with self-direct learning practices in the Faculty.

Title: Self-directed Learning (SDL) and Development of Competencies among Students of the University of Bamenda
Journal: American journal of education and practice
Abstract: Purpose: This study examines the relationship between self-directed learning (SDL) and development of competencies among students of the University of Bamenda (UBa). Methodology: The argument for this study anchored on Vygosky's Social Constructivism Theory, Cognitive Apprenticeship Theory of Collins et al., and Tchombe's Mediated Mutual Reciprocity Theory. A correlational survey research design, with a quantitative approach for data collection was used.

Title: Fostering Self-Directed Learning in Higher Education: The Efficacy of Guided Learning Approach among First-Year University Students in Malaysia
Journal: Journal of Cognitive Sciences and Human Development
Abstract: The present study investigates the efficacy of the guided learning approach in promoting self-directedness among first-year, first-semester university students in Malaysia. Based on a sample of 37 participants, this study employs the SECI (Socialization, Externalization, Combination, and Internalization) Model as a theoretical framework to examine the transfer of knowledge between the lecturer and students, as well as among students.
Categoria: Abordagem de Aprendizagem Guiada, Ensino Superior

Title: The Role of Self-Directed Learning Strategies in Improving the Academic Performance of Students with Learning Disabilities
Abstract: Self -directed learning is a strategy widely used with normal students . Numerous educational initiatives have been launched to expand its use among school children and university students. Though, there is still a great need to spread this term in the field of disability.

Title: COOPERATIVE LEARNING STRATEGIES FOR PROMOTION OF STUDENT'S SELF-DIRECTION
Abstract: This article presents results of promotion of students self-direction in cooperative learning in teacher training. The purpose of the study was to work out and implement an cooperative learning model for promotion of student self-directed learning skills in teacher training in university, and explore the relationships between the cooperative learning process and self-directed learning development.

Title: Applying Self-Directed Learning in Teaching Technical Drawing: Results of a Study in Real Situation at Universities of Technology and Education
Abstract: Teaching based on self-directed learning is considered a teaching perspective that focuses the teaching process on learners' learning activities, helping learners to increase their active, positive and self-discipline in learning, to meet the requirements of lifelong learning. The characteristics of teaching technical drawing at universities require very high self-study in students, from determining learning goals to determining the learning process and ways to achieve results of the highest learning.

Title: Self-directed learning: A tool for lifelong learning
Abstract: The notion of lifelong learning implies that learning is not confined to childhood or the classroom, but can take place throughout life and in a range of situations. Supporting the development of lifelong learning has become a global educational, social, and economic goal today as evidenced by the sustainable development goal 4 established by the United Nations. Assessment is recognized for its central role in supporting lifelong learning, but there is an assessment gap at present as most assessments do not support the knowledge, skills, and attitudes needed for lifelong learning. This paper examines self-directed learning as a tool to support lifelong learning and elaborates on the role of assessment to cultivate essential lifelong learning habits of self-directed reflection and self-monitoring.
Categoria: Aprendizagem ao Longo da Vida, Autoavaliação

Title: Self study enhances the learning effect of online discussion
Journal: Journal of Science Education and Technology
Abstract: This study aimed to compare the academic outcome of a 'self study-discussion' mode of learning with an 'online peer discussion' mode among pharmacy students and to determine how online peer discussion, specifically, affected the learning process in terms of students' preparation, knowledge construction, and tutor role.

Title: Self-directed and lifelong learning: A framework for improving nursing students' learning skills in the clinical context
Authors: Pilar Pérez-Rojo, Eva María Martín-Álvarez, Rafael López-Higes, Carmen Amador-Toledano, Cristina Fernández-Alonso, Lorenzo Casado-López, Manuel Abellán-Hervás
Abstract: Background: Self-directed learning (SDL) is essential for continuous learning throughout life. In healthcare professions, SDL is an essential competence in meeting accreditation criteria, as well as in preparing graduates to be effective lifelong learners. The development of SDL involves a constructivist approach, so it is important to apply strategies that include both the analysis of learning contexts and problem-solving.

Title: Reframing the meaning of self-directed learning: An updated model
Authors: Susan L. Stockdale, Joel E. Williams
Journal: Adult Education in the Digital Age: Perspectives on Participation and Pedagogy
Abstract: This paper presents the PRO model of SDL, which suggests that the process of becoming a self-directed learner is unique to each individual with specific focus on the affective domain. The framework updates the Personal Responsibility Orientation (PRO) model developed by Brockett and Hiemstra (1991), emphasizing individual characteristics (IC) as a function of the teaching and learning (TL) process.

Title: Development of a self-rating scale of self-directed learning
Authors: Cheng, S. F., Kuo, C. L., Lin, K. C., & Lee-Hsieh, J.
Abstract: Background: Self-directed learning (SDL) is a key competence for healthcare profession students. Measurement instruments for self-assessment of SDL skills have been lacking in Taiwan. Aim: To develop and test a self-rating scale for self-directed learning (SRSSDL) in Taiwan. Method: The scale has 20 items across four domains: learning motivation, planning and implementing, self-monitoring, and interpersonal communication.
Tags: acesso_comPDF, aprendizagem autodirigida, escala de medição

Title: Self-directed learning in adulthood: A literature review
Journal: International Journal of Continuing Education and Lifelong Learning
Abstract: This paper provides a review of the literature on self-directed learning in adulthood. The review examines definitions, models, and perspectives on self-directed learning, as well as research related to this important concept. In particular, four areas are explored: The nature of self-directed learning, the process of self-directed learning, self-directedness as a personal attribute, and self-directed learning in various settings. The paper concludes with recommendations for future research on self-directed learning.
Categoria: Revisão de Literatura, Estado da Arte

Title: READINESS FACTORS CONTRIBUTING TO PARTICIPANT SATISFACTION IN ONLINE HIGHER EDUCATION COURSES
Abstract: The purpose of this study was to examine readiness factors influencing learner satisfaction in online higher education courses. The readiness factors examined in the study included: (a) computer and Internet self-efficacy, (b) prior online learning experiences, (c) course design, and (d) learner characteristics. The study findings revealed that computer and Internet self-efficacy and course design were significant predictors of learner satisfaction.

Title: A auto-eficácia para a aprendizagem autodirigida como pilar fundamental da educação e aprendizagem ao longo da vida: Continuação dos estudos de validação do Self-Efficacy for Self-Directed Learning Questionnaire
Authors: Oliveira, Albertina L.; Silva, José T.
LitmapsId: Este artigo apresenta os resultados de um estudo com o objetivo de validar uma escala para medir a autoeficácia para a aprendizagem autodirigida, considerando sua importância fundamental para a educação e aprendizagem ao longo da vida. A amostra foi composta por 460 adultos, estudantes do ensino superior, com idades entre 18 e 48 anos.

Title: Self-Direction for Lifelong Learning: A Comprehensive Guide to Theory and Practice
Abstract: Resenha por Jean Ellen Jones. Este livro fornece um panorama abrangente da aprendizagem autodirigida, cobrindo a teoria e a prática, e oferecendo ideias valiosas para educadores e pesquisadores. O livro é estruturado em cinco partes que abordam o escopo e significado da aprendizagem autodirigida, as dimensões da autodireção, insights teóricos, promoção da autodireção na aprendizagem e realização do potencial da autodireção na aprendizagem de adultos.

Title: Aprendizagem ao Longo da Vida: uma condição fundamental para a carreira
Authors: Teixeira, Marco Antônio Pereira; Gomes, William Barbosa
Abstract: Este artigo discute a importância da aprendizagem ao longo da vida como condição fundamental para o desenvolvimento de carreira no contexto atual. A partir de uma revisão teórica, são apresentados os conceitos de aprendizagem ao longo da vida e aprendizagem autodirigida, destacando sua relevância para o desenvolvimento profissional contínuo.
Tags: aprendizagem ao longo da vida, carreira, português

Title: Self-Directed Learning in Adulthood: Perspectives from Research
Journal: International Encyclopedia of Adult Education and Training
Abstract: Este capítulo fornece uma visão geral abrangente da pesquisa sobre aprendizagem autodirigida na vida adulta. A autora explora as diferentes perspectivas e definições de aprendizagem autodirigida, os principais modelos conceituais, e as implicações para a prática educacional.
Categoria: Estado da Arte, Perspectivas de Pesquisa

Title: The Modern Practice of Adult Education: From Pedagogy to Andragogy
Abstract: Este livro é considerado uma obra seminal na educação de adultos, onde Knowles desenvolve o conceito de andragogia em contraste com a pedagogia tradicional. O autor apresenta um modelo prático para o planejamento, implementação e avaliação de programas educacionais para adultos, com foco especial na aprendizagem autodirigida como característica fundamental do aprendiz adulto. O livro aborda cinco pressupostos sobre o aprendizado de adultos: autoconceito, papel da experiência, prontidão para aprender, orientação para a aprendizagem e motivação.

Title: The Adult's Learning Projects: A Fresh Approach to Theory and Practice in Adult Learning
Journal: Ontario Institute for Studies in Education
Abstract: Nesta obra fundamental, Allen Tough apresenta os resultados de suas pesquisas sobre projetos de aprendizagem autodirigidos realizados por adultos. O estudo revela que adultos tipicamente se engajam em vários projetos de aprendizagem por ano, a maioria deles planejados e executados pelos próprios aprendizes. Tough identifica os padrões, motivações e processos envolvidos nessas iniciativas de aprendizagem, estabelecendo uma base empírica para a compreensão da aprendizagem autodirigida.
Tags: livro_seminal, aprendizagem autodirigida, projetos de aprendizagem
Categoria: Projetos de Aprendizagem, Pesquisa Empírica, Autodidatismo

Title: The Art of Self-Directed Learning: 23 Tips for Giving Yourself an Unconventional Education
Abstract: Este livro prático oferece 23 estratégias para desenvolver habilidades de aprendizagem autodirigida. O autor, educador alternativo e defensor da desescolarização, compartilha insights sobre como assumir o controle da própria educação, desenvolver projetos significativos, conectar-se com mentores e comunidades de aprendizagem, e cultivar a autodisciplina necessária para o sucesso no aprendizado autodirigido.
Tags: aprendizagem autodirigida, guia prático, educação alternativa

Title: Self-Directed Learning for the 21st Century: Implications for Higher Education
Authors: Mentz, Elsa; Bailey, Roxanne; De Beer, Josef (eds.)
Abstract: Esta coletânea examina a aprendizagem autodirigida no contexto da educação superior contemporânea. Os capítulos abordam temas como a integração de tecnologias digitais, estratégias de implementação em diferentes disciplinas, desenvolvimento de instrumentos de avaliação para SDL, e o papel do SDL no desenvolvimento de competências para a era digital. O livro situa o SDL como componente essencial para preparar graduados para os desafios da aprendizagem contínua em um mundo em rápida transformação.
Tags: aprendizagem autodirigida, ensino superior, século XXI
Categoria: Educação Superior, Tecnologia Educacional, Competências para o Século XXI

Title: Lifelong Learners – O poder do aprendizado contínuo
Abstract: Este livro em português explora o conceito de aprendizagem ao longo da vida e sua relação com a aprendizagem autodirigida. O autor apresenta estratégias para desenvolver hábitos de aprendizagem contínua, cultivar a curiosidade, e adaptar-se às constantes mudanças do mercado de trabalho. A obra discute como as pessoas podem assumir protagonismo em seu desenvolvimento contínuo, criando e implementando projetos pessoais de aprendizagem.
Tags: aprendizagem ao longo da vida, português, desenvolvimento pessoal
Categoria: Aprendizagem Contínua, Desenvolvimento Profissional, Contexto Brasileiro

Title: Self-Directed Learning: An Imperative for Education in a Complex Society
Abstract: Este volume analisa a aprendizagem autodirigida como resposta às demandas educacionais em contextos sociais complexos. Os autores exploram abordagens teóricas e práticas para implementar SDL em diversos ambientes educacionais, com ênfase em como a autodireção na aprendizagem pode ajudar estudantes a desenvolverem resiliência, adaptabilidade e capacidade de solução de problemas em contextos de incerteza e complexidade.

Title: Problem-Based Learning and Pedagogies of Play: Active Learning for Self-Directed Learning Development
Authors: Havenga, Marietjie; Olivier, Jako; Bunt, Byron J.; et al.
Abstract: Esta obra examina a conexão entre aprendizagem baseada em problemas (PBL), pedagogias do brincar e o desenvolvimento da aprendizagem autodirigida. Os autores apresentam fundamentos teóricos e casos práticos demonstrando como abordagens ativas de aprendizagem fomentam a autodireção. O livro é especialmente relevante para educadores interessados em transformar ambientes tradicionais de ensino em espaços que promovam a autonomia e o engajamento ativo dos estudantes.
Tags: aprendizagem baseada em problemas, pedagogias ativas, aprendizagem autodirigida

Title: Advances in Research and Practice in Self-Directed Learning
Journal: Oklahoma Research Center for Continuing Professional and Higher Education
Abstract: Esta coletânea reúne pesquisas significativas sobre aprendizagem autodirigida, destacando desenvolvimentos teóricos e aplicações práticas. Os capítulos abrangem medição de prontidão para SDL, estratégias para facilitar a aprendizagem autodirigida em diversos contextos, e análises do impacto de fatores socioculturais na autodireção. O livro representa um marco importante na evolução da pesquisa sobre SDL.
Categoria: Pesquisa em SDL, Instrumentos de Medição, Facilitação da SDL

Title: Adventures in Self-Directed Learning: A Guide for Nurturing Learner Agency and Ownership
Abstract: Este guia prático fornece estratégias para educadores e pais interessados em nutrir a agência e autonomia dos aprendizes. O autor, especialista em tecnologia educacional e educação personalizada, oferece insights sobre como criar ambientes que apoiem a curiosidade, a iniciativa e a autodireção. O livro inclui exemplos concretos, estudos de caso e ferramentas para implementar práticas de aprendizagem autodirigida em diversos contextos.
Tags: aprendizagem autodirigida, agência do aprendiz, autonomia
Categoria: Agência do Aprendiz, Autonomia, Ambientes de Aprendizagem

Title: Self-Directed Learning: A Guide for Learners and Teachers
Abstract: Esta obra apresenta os conceitos fundamentais da aprendizagem autodirigida, definindo abordagens práticas tanto para aprendizes quanto para educadores. Knowles articula princípios e estratégias para que os indivíduos assumam maior responsabilidade por sua própria aprendizagem, além de oferecer diretrizes para educadores sobre como facilitar experiências de aprendizagem autodirigida. O livro fornece exemplos concretos de contratos de aprendizagem e outras ferramentas para implementação da SDL.
Categoria: Guia Prático, Contratos de Aprendizagem, Facilitação da Aprendizagem

Title: Assessment Strategies for Self-Directed Learning
Abstract: Este livro aborda especificamente a questão da avaliação na aprendizagem autodirigida, apresentando estratégias e ferramentas para avaliar o desenvolvimento de habilidades de autodireção dos aprendizes. Os autores discutem a importância de alinhar avaliação formativa e somativa com os objetivos da aprendizagem autodirigida, bem como o papel da reflexão, autoavaliação e feedback na promoção da autonomia do aprendiz.

Title: Self-Directed Learning: Curriculum Implementation
Journal: Van der Westhuizen, Christo; Golightly, Aubrey (eds.)
LitmapsId: Esta coletânea explora a implementação curricular da aprendizagem autodirigida em diversos contextos educacionais. Os autores discutem como os princípios do SDL podem ser integrados no planejamento, entrega e avaliação curricular. O livro apresenta estudos de caso de diferentes disciplinas e níveis educacionais, oferecendo insights sobre os desafios e oportunidades na integração sistemática do SDL em programas educacionais formais.
Categoria: implementação curricular, aprendizagem autodirigida, prática educacional

Title: The Decolonisation of the Curriculum Project
Abstract: Este volume examina a aprendizagem autodirigida no contexto da descolonização curricular. Os autores exploram como abordagens de SDL podem contribuir para a transformação educacional em contextos pós-coloniais, promovendo a incorporação de conhecimentos indígenas e perspectivas culturalmente diversas. O livro apresenta casos específicos de implementação de SDL em currículos descolonizados, principalmente no contexto sul-africano.

Title: Measuring self-directed learning: A diagnostic tool for adult learners
Journal: Journal of University Teaching and Learning Practice
Abstract: Este estudo visa desenvolver uma ferramenta de diagnóstico para avaliar as habilidades de aprendizagem autodirigida de alunos adultos no ensino superior. Através de uma metodologia mista, o autor desenvolve e valida o Inventário de Aprendizagem Autodirigida (SDLI), que mede sete dimensões: iniciativa de aprendizagem, autodisciplina, gestão do tempo, estratégias de aprendizagem, avaliação da aprendizagem, atributos pessoais e gestão de apoio externo. O instrumento é projetado para ajudar educadores a identificar áreas de intervenção para melhorar a autodireção dos estudantes.
Tags: instrumentos de medição, aprendizagem de adultos, educação superior

Title: Self-directed learning in MOOCs: Exploring the relationships among motivation
Year: Zhu, M., Bonk, C. J., & Doo, M. Y.
Abstract: Computers & Education
Cited By: Este estudo investiga as relações entre motivação, automonitoramento, autogestão e estratégias de aprendizagem de estudantes em Cursos Online Abertos e Massivos (MOOCs). Através de uma pesquisa com 470 participantes, os autores encontraram relações significativas entre essas variáveis, demonstrando que o automonitoramento medeia a relação entre motivação e autogestão. Os resultados destacam a importância de incorporar atividades que promovam o automonitoramento e a autogestão em ambientes de aprendizagem online para apoiar o desenvolvimento da autodireção nos estudantes.

Title: Scaffolding self-directed learning with personalized learning path recommendations
Authors: Wardrip, P. S., & Shapiro, R. B.
Abstract: Este estudo apresenta um sistema de recomendação de trajetórias de aprendizagem personalizadas projetado para promover a aprendizagem autodirigida em ambientes online. O sistema combina análise de aprendizagem e inteligência artificial para sugerir recursos e atividades adaptados às necessidades e interesses individuais dos estudantes. Os resultados mostram que os alunos que receberam recomendações personalizadas demonstraram maior engajamento, persistência e resultados de aprendizagem em comparação com um grupo controle.

Title: The self-directed online learning framework: Supporting the development of self-direction in online courses
Journal: International Journal of Educational Technology in Higher Education
Abstract: Este estudo propõe um framework abrangente para desenvolver habilidades de autodireção em cursos online. O modelo identifica cinco componentes cruciais: planejamento da aprendizagem, monitoramento do progresso, avaliação dos resultados, gerenciamento de recursos e desenvolvimento de comunidades de aprendizagem. Os autores apresentam estratégias práticas para implementar cada componente no design de cursos online, bem como evidências empíricas da eficácia dessas abordagens em um estudo com estudantes universitários.

Title: Promoting teacher self-direction: A framework for leadership support
Authors: Baird, T. J., & Fisher, D. R.
Abstract: Este artigo investiga como administradores escolares e líderes educacionais podem promover e apoiar o desenvolvimento da autodireção em professores. Utilizando uma abordagem de estudo de caso em várias escolas, os autores desenvolvem um framework para liderança que identifica práticas eficazes para criar um ambiente que nutre a aprendizagem autodirigida em educadores. As estratégias incluem estabelecer uma cultura de confiança, fornecer recursos adequados, modelar práticas de reflexão, e implementar sistemas de desenvolvimento profissional baseados em projetos.
Tags: formação de professores, liderança educacional, desenvolvimento profissional

Title: Facilitating self-directed learning (SDL) in higher education through the metaverse
Authors: Shin, J., Kim, H., & Park, S. B.
Abstract: Este estudo explora o potencial do metaverso como ambiente para facilitar a aprendizagem autodirigida no ensino superior. Os autores desenvolveram e testaram um ambiente de aprendizagem baseado em metaverso que incorpora elementos de gamificação, simulação e interação social para promover a autonomia, motivação e autorregulação dos estudantes. Os resultados demonstram melhorias significativas nas habilidades de autodireção, particularmente em planejamento de aprendizagem e autoavaliação, além de aumento no engajamento e na satisfação dos participantes.

Title: Discussão sobre as Abordagens Associadas à Aprendizagem Autodirigida e sua Relação com as Tecnologias Educacionais
Authors: SANTOS, V. L. P., et al.
Journal: Revista Brasileira de Educação em Computação
Abstract: O artigo busca analisar as diferentes abordagens pedagógicas associadas à aprendizagem autodirigida (SDL) e como essas abordagens se relacionam com as tecnologias educacionais contemporâneas, especialmente no contexto da formação em computação. Estabelece um comparativo entre diferentes modelos de implementação de SDL em ambientes digitais e propõe um framework integrado que conecta abordagens pedagógicas de SDL com ferramentas tecnológicas específicas.
Tags: tecnologia educacional, aprendizagem autodirigida, formação em computação

Title: A autoformação docente como objeto de pesquisa: estado do conhecimento (2013-2022)
Authors: SILVA, M. H.; MORAES, D. A. F.
Abstract: Mapear o estado do conhecimento sobre autoformação docente no Brasil durante o período de 2013 a 2022, analisando tendências, metodologias e resultados das pesquisas nacionais sobre o tema. Identifica o panorama da pesquisa brasileira sobre autoformação docente e estabelece conexões conceituais entre autoformação docente e aprendizagem autodirigida.
Tags: autoformação docente, educação brasileira, aprendizagem autodirigida

Title: A ATUAÇÃO DO DESIGNER INSTRUCIONAL PARA A APRENDIZAGEM AUTODIRIGIDA UTILIZANDO AS TECNOLOGIAS DIGITAIS
Authors: OLIVEIRA, C. R.; SANTOS, F. M.
Abstract: Investigar o papel do designer instrucional no desenvolvimento de ambientes de aprendizagem que promovam a autodireção dos estudantes, com foco específico no uso de tecnologias digitais. Analisa as competências específicas necessárias ao designer instrucional para fomentar SDL e apresenta um conjunto de estratégias concretas para desenho de ambientes virtuais que estimulem autonomia.
Tags: design instrucional, tecnologias digitais, aprendizagem autodirigida

Title: O ChatGPT como ferramenta de apoio educacional: uma análise de seu potencial no processo de ensino e aprendizagem
Authors: COSTA, R. S.; MARTINS, E. F.
Abstract: Analisar o potencial do ChatGPT como ferramenta de apoio educacional, com ênfase em como esta tecnologia pode contribuir para processos de aprendizagem autodirigida. Apresenta casos de uso do ChatGPT para estimular a autonomia na aprendizagem e propõe um framework para integração da IA generativa em processos educacionais que promovam SDL.

Title: APRENDIZAGEM AUTODIRIGIDA E DESIGN INSTRUCIONAL: CAMINHOS E POSSIBILIDADES
Authors: PEREIRA, A. M.; COSTA, J. W.
Journal: Revista Brasileira de Informática na Educação
Abstract: Explorar as intersecções entre aprendizagem autodirigida e design instrucional, propondo caminhos metodológicos para o desenvolvimento de ambientes de aprendizagem que potencializem a autonomia dos estudantes. Estabelece princípios de design instrucional específicos para promoção da SDL e apresenta um modelo teórico-prático para avaliação da autodireção em ambientes de aprendizagem.

Title: Student Perception of Active Learning Group in a Problem-Based Learning Curricular Environment
Authors: Cheryl Melovitz-Vasan, Matthew Gentile, Susan Huff, Nagaswami Vasan
Abstract: Este estudo analisa a percepção dos estudantes sobre o uso de Active Learning Group (ALG), uma forma híbrida de Problem-Based Learning (PBL), dentro do currículo médico. O estudo avalia a eficácia desse modelo em termos de profissionalismo, experiência positiva de aprendizagem e colaboração entre os alunos. Os resultados revelaram uma avaliação bastante positiva dos estudantes, destacando os benefícios do ALG em relação à colaboração e ao desenvolvimento de habilidades de resolução de problemas clínicos.

Title: The Influence of Blended Learning Environment on Self-Regulated and Self-Directed Learning Skills of Learners
Abstract: Este estudo compara o impacto de ambientes de aprendizagem híbridos nas habilidades de auto-regulação e aprendizagem autodirigida dos alunos, em comparação com métodos tradicionais. A pesquisa demonstra que o ambiente híbrido, com sua flexibilidade e recursos diversos, potencializa significativamente o desenvolvimento da autodireção na aprendizagem. Os resultados mostram que, ao ter controle sobre seu próprio ritmo de aprendizagem, os alunos podem adaptar seu processo de estudo conforme suas necessidades individuais.

Title: Teaching and Instructional Design Approaches to Enhance Students' Self-Directed Learning in Blended Learning Environments
Abstract: Investiga abordagens de ensino e design instrucional que melhoram a aprendizagem autodirigida em ambientes híbridos, enfatizando métodos centrados no aluno. O estudo destaca que professores que utilizam atividades interativas, como discussões em fóruns online e revisões entre pares, promovem um ambiente em que os alunos se tornam mais responsáveis por seu próprio processo de aprendizagem, incentivando a reflexão crítica e fornecendo feedback imediato.
Tags: design instrucional, blended learning, aprendizagem autodirigida

Title: Self-study enhances the learning effect of discussions
Abstract: Este estudo investiga como o autoestudo melhora os efeitos de aprendizagem nas discussões. A pesquisa mostra que estudantes que realizaram estudo individual prévio à discussão obtiveram desempenho superior em testes, especialmente em itens que exigiam transferência do conhecimento para novos contextos. A análise qualitativa revelou que os estudantes que tiveram momentos prévios de autodireção conseguiram interagir mais ativamente durante as discussões em grupo.

Title: Fostering Self-Directed Learning in Higher Education: The Efficacy of Guided Learning Approach among First-Year University Students in Malaysia
Authors: Ida Juliana Hutasuhut, Mohamad Azhari Abu Bakar, Kartini Abdul Ghani, Dorkas Ping Bilong
Journal: Journal of Cognitive Sciences and Human Development
Abstract: Analisa a eficácia de uma abordagem guiada para fomentar a aprendizagem autodirigida entre estudantes universitários de primeiro ano na Malásia. Utilizando o modelo SECI (Socialização, Externalização, Combinação e Internalização), o estudo demonstra que 94.59% dos participantes apresentaram aumento em suas habilidades autodirigidas após a intervenção. A pesquisa conclui que a interação direta com um facilitador é essencial para auxiliar os estudantes no desenvolvimento da iniciativa e responsabilidade.

Title: Lessons from Self-Directed Learning Activities and Helping University Students Think Critically
Abstract: Apresenta os benefícios das atividades de aprendizagem autodirigida como ferramentas para aprimorar o pensamento crítico dos estudantes universitários. Através de atividades como entrevistas com profissionais, discussões em grupo e produção textual, os estudantes desenvolveram habilidades de pensamento crítico, comunicação e gestão do tempo. As entrevistas qualitativas revelaram que o envolvimento nestas atividades levou os estudantes a expandir suas perspectivas sobre aprendizagem.

Title: Self-study in Teaching and Teacher Education: Characteristics and contributions
Abstract: Analisa a pesquisa de autoestudo no ensino e educação de professores, destacando as contribuições para o desenvolvimento profissional. O estudo revela que o autoestudo promove uma compreensão mais profunda do professor sobre sua prática, levando a transformações significativas no comportamento profissional. A autora defende que professores engajados no autoestudo adquirem maior capacidade para promover aprendizagens mais significativas e reflexivas.
Tags: autoestudo, formação de professores, desenvolvimento profissional

Title: Introducing cooperative learning: students' attitudes towards learning and the implications for self-directed learning
Abstract: Explora as atitudes dos alunos em relação à aprendizagem cooperativa e as implicações para a aprendizagem autodirigida. Os resultados mostram que o uso sistemático de estratégias cooperativas melhorou significativamente as atitudes dos alunos, ampliando sua motivação, autonomia e responsabilidade individual. O contexto cooperativo potencializou nos estudantes o desenvolvimento de habilidades interpessoais e comunicativas, além de reforçar a consciência sobre a importância do engajamento pessoal.

Title: Comparative study of self-directed learning and traditional teaching method in understanding cardio-respiratory physiology among medical undergraduates
Abstract: Compara o impacto dos métodos de aprendizagem autodirigida e do ensino tradicional em cursos de fisiologia médica. Os resultados mostram que alunos expostos a metodologias autodirigidas exibiram desempenho significativamente superior em termos de retenção de conhecimentos, desenvolvimento de habilidades críticas e capacidade de aplicar conceitos teóricos em situações práticas. O estudo evidencia o potencial do aprendizado autodirigido para formar estudantes mais preparados para enfrentar desafios práticos.
Tags: comparação de métodos, aprendizagem autodirigida, educação médica

Title: Cooperative Learning Strategies for Promotion of Student's self-direction
Abstract: Aborda as estratégias de aprendizagem cooperativa para promover o aprendizado autodirigido. O estudo confirma que estratégias cooperativas, quando aplicadas à formação de professores, promovem efetivamente melhorias na prontidão para a aprendizagem autodirigida, especialmente em estudantes inicialmente classificados com níveis médios ou baixos. Em um contexto experimental, foi possível perceber que todos os estudantes apresentaram ganhos na capacidade de autodireção, enquanto em contextos tradicionais esse benefício foi significativamente restrito.

Title: Evaluation of Self-Directed Learning Readiness Among Medical Students in Sharjah, the United Arab Emirates
Authors: Emad A. Nosair, Mohammad Omar, Ghaith AlWawi
Abstract: Avalia a prontidão para aprendizagem autodirigida entre estudantes de medicina em Sharjah, Emirados Árabes Unidos. O estudo buscou identificar diferenças na prontidão para SDL entre alunos participantes de programas baseados na aprendizagem por problemas e programas tradicionais. Os resultados revelaram que não houve diferenças significativas entre os grupos, mas destacaram que alunos com alto desempenho acadêmico apresentaram níveis superiores de prontidão, evidenciando o papel crucial dos fatores intrínsecos.
Tags: prontidão para SDL, educação médica, avaliação

Title: In Search of Intellectual Stimulation: Understanding the Relationship Between Motivation, Deep Learning and Stimulation in the Higher Education Classroom
Journal: Journal on Today's Ideas Tomorrow's Technologies
Abstract: Investiga a relação entre motivação, aprendizagem profunda e estimulação no contexto da sala de aula universitária. A pesquisa identificou correlações positivas entre o nível de estímulo intelectual proporcionado nas aulas, o grau de motivação intrínseca dos alunos e a adoção de abordagens mais profundas e reflexivas de aprendizagem. Os autores concluíram que um ambiente educacional intelectualmente estimulante é essencial para que os estudantes adotem abordagens mais profundas em sua aprendizagem.

Title: Problem-based learning in medicine and beyond: A brief overview
Journal: New Directions for Teaching and Learning
Abstract: Este artigo seminal apresenta uma visão geral da aprendizagem baseada em problemas (PBL) em medicina e outras áreas. Barrows explica os fundamentos teóricos do PBL, seus princípios pedagógicos e os benefícios para o desenvolvimento de habilidades como resolução de problemas, pensamento crítico e aprendizagem autodirigida. O autor, pioneiro no desenvolvimento do PBL, descreve as características essenciais dessa abordagem e como ela pode ser adaptada para diferentes contextos educacionais.
